page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: The villages of{Gainford}and{Headlam lie in the Tees Plain, midway between Darlington and Barnard Castle. The surrounding countryside is agricultural farmland which is sparcely populated and interspersed with attractive farmhouses. Good quality grazing is to be found for a variety of livestock and a wide selection of arable crops are grown successfully. {Gainford}today is a dormitory village, with the majority of working adults commuting to larger towns, such as Darlington and Bishop Auckland. The village has become largely residential and is a thriving community. {Headlam,}however, is smaller and more rural in character. White painted cottages and farm buildings seem to predominate.
